page.title: 12Jersey Radio (2)
page.content:
The officers can communicate with sea rescue authorities in Jersey, Guernsey, and France (CROSSMA). These stations can give position fixes to ships with a VHF radio transmitter. The D/F aeriel takes the bearings of ships transmitting on VHF channels 16, 25 and 82.
At regular intervals are broadcast Weather forecasts, gale and navigation warnings. In addition there are messages to pilots, owners, and harbours officers with boat arrival and departure times, cargo details and numbers of passengers.
Link calls on VHF channels 25 and 82 can be made for ships within 30 miles of Jersey, enabling them to make telephone calls to anywhere in the world.
